qas.question: When was The Shevchenko Ukrainian Language Society made official?
The three human rights activists reburied November 19th were prisoners where?
Where was Gulag Camp No. 36 located?
Who met with Gorbachev on November 22?

context: In <a0_0>mid-November<a0_0/> The Shevchenko Ukrainian Language Society was officially registered. On November 19, 1989, a public gathering in Kiev attracted thousands of mourners, friends and family to the reburial in Ukraine of three inmates of the infamous <a1_0>Gulag Camp No. 36<a1_0/> in <a2_0>Perm in the Ural Mountains<a2_0/>: human-rights activists Vasyl Stus, Oleksiy Tykhy, and Yuriy Lytvyn. Their remains were reinterred in <a3_0>Baikove Cemetery.<a3_0/> On November 26, 1989, a day of prayer and fasting was proclaimed by Cardinal Myroslav Lubachivsky, thousands of faithful in western Ukraine participated in religious services on the eve of a meeting between <a4_0>Pope John Paul II<a4_0/> and Soviet President Gorbachev. On November 28, 1989, the Ukrainian SSR's Council for Religious Affairs issued a decree allowing Ukrainian Catholic congregations to register as legal organizations. The decree was proclaimed on December 1, coinciding with a meeting at the Vatican between the pope and the Soviet president.
